snippet: Mr. Biggs gained international fame for his role in one of Britain’s best-known crimes, the Great Train Robbery of 1963, and his subsequent life on the run.
abstract: Ronnie Biggs, who became an international celebrity for his role in the Great Train Robbery of 1963 in Great Britain, eluding a worldwide manhunt by Scotland Yard for decades, dies at age 84.

byline.contributor: Alan Cowell contributed reporting from London.

lead_paragraph: Mr. Biggs gained international fame for his role in one of Britain’s best-known crimes, the Great Train Robbery of 1963, and his subsequent life on the run.

headline.main: Ronnie Biggs, Longtime Fugitive After the Great Train Robbery, Dies at 84
headline.print_headline: Ronnie Biggs, Longtime Fugitive After the Great Train Robbery, Dies at 84
